title: In ABC triangle A angle is 30 degrees and AB=AC, then what is the degree of B angle? - Quora

response.answer_text: Ans: Given AB=AC that means if we draw a triangle with A,B and C as vortices then angle opposite to the side AB must be equal to the angle opposite to the side AC i.e angle B=angle C . It is given that angle A = 30 degree. As we know sum of 3 angles in a triangle = 180 degree So angle A + angle B + angle C = 180 degree => angle B + angle C= 180 degree - angle A = 180 degree - 30 degree=150 degree => 2 angle B =150 degree ( since angle B = angle C) => angle B = 150 degree/2 = 75 degree( Ans)
In ABC triangle A angle is 30 degrees and AB=AC, then what is the degree of B angle? Solution: ABC is an isosceles triangle as AB=AC and <A = 30 deg. <B = <C = (180–30)/2 = 75 deg. Answer
